created-after.description: Filter results created after this date (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD)

created-before.description: Filter results created before this date (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD)

edited-after.description: Filter results edited after this date (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD)
edited-after.name: edited-after

edited-before.description: Filter results edited before this date (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD)
edited-before.name: edited-before

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return (applied after filters)
limit.name: limit

db:schema.description: Extract clean, AI-parseable schema from a Notion data source (table). This command is optimized for AI agents and automation - it returns property names, types, options (for select/multi-select), and configuration in an easy-to-parse format.

examples.description: Get full schema in JSON format (recommended for AI agents)
Get schema with property payload examples (recommended for AI agents)
Get schema using database URL
Get schema as formatted table
Get schema with examples in human-readable format
Get schema in YAML format
Get only specific properties
examples.command: <%= config.bin %> db schema abc123def456 --properties Name,Status,Tags --output json

examples.description: Get schema as markdown documentation
Parse schema with jq (extract property names)
examples.command: <%= config.bin %> db schema abc123def456 --output json | jq '.data.properties[].name'

examples.description: Find all select/multi-select properties and their options
examples.command: <%= config.bin %> db schema abc123def456 --output json | jq '.data.properties[] | select(.options) | {name, options}'

properties.name: properties

minimal.description: Strip unnecessary metadata (created_by, last_edited_by, object fields, request_id, etc.) - reduces response size by ~40%
minimal.name: minimal

block:retrieve:children.description: Retrieve block children (supports database discovery via --show-databases)

examples.description: Retrieve block children
Retrieve block children and output raw json
Retrieve block children and output JSON for automation
Discover databases on a page with queryable IDs
Get databases as JSON for automation

show-databases.description: show only child databases with their queryable IDs (data_source_id)
show-databases.name: show-databases

sort.description: Property to sort by (prepend with - for descending)
sort.name: sort

no-truncate.description: Do not truncate output to fit screen
no-truncate.name: no-truncate

page-size.description: Items per page (1-100, default: 100 for automation)
page-size.name: page-size

retry.description: Auto-retry on rate limit (respects Retry-After header)
retry.name: retry

no-cache.description: Bypass cache and force fresh API calls
no-cache.name: no-cache
